full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/26/2023 4. Are you presently in the United States? Yes No If not presently in the United States, on what date did you depart? Actual date of departure Have you departed the United States, and returned, since the filing of this application? Yes No If you are not presently in the United States, you must submit evidence to establish the date you departed the United States such as a copy of your transportation ticket, flight itinerary, etc. You must establish that you were present in the United States on the date you filed this application. If you have not departed the United States yet, on what date do you intend to depart? Date of intended departure Submit a copy of your travel arrangements, or other evidence, verifying your proposed date of departure (transportation ticket, flight itinerary, etc.) (131Q3A) 5. Submit a copy of a photo identity document showing your picture, name, and date of birth. Such a document can be a copy of the identity page from your passport, a driver's license, or another type of photo ID with the same information. The identity document copy must clearly show the photograph and identity information. (1310.1) 6. Form I-131 must be accompanied by two photos; therefore, please submit two color photos of yourself, taken within the last 30 days, and not previously used. These photos must have a white background. Photos must be glossy, unretouched, and not mounted. Dimension of the facial image should be about 1 inch from chin to top of hair or head, shown in 3/4 frontal view of right side of face with right ear visible. Using soft pencil or felt pen, print name (and alien registration receipt number, if known) on the back of each photograph. You should show these instructions to the photographer who takes the pictures. (131B) 7.X Sign photocopy of application in Part8 Your response must be received in this office by NOVEMBER 9, 1998 . MONTH / DAY / YEAR Your case is being held in this office pending your response. Within this period you may: 1. Submit all of the evidence requested; 2. Submit some or none of the evidence requested and ask for a decision based-upon the record; or 3. Withdraw the application or petition. You must submit all of the evidence at one time. Submission of only part of the evidence requested will be considered a request for a decision based upon the record. No extension of the period allowed to submit evidence will be granted. If the evidence submitted does not establish that your case was approvable at the time it was filed, it will be denied. If you do not respond to this request within the time allowed, your case will be considered abandoned and denied. Evidence received in this office after the due date will not be considered. PLACE THIS LETTER ON TOP OF YOUR RESPONSE. SUBMISSION OF EVIDENCE WITHOUT THIS LETTER WILL DELAY PROCESSING OF YOUR CASE AND MAY RESULT IN A DENIAL. PLEASE USE THE ATTACHED LABEL FOR MAILING THIS EVIDENCE BACK TO THIS OFFICE. Sincerely, Natalie Vedder NSC Director NSC/KLJ-EX148 aua
